content: Great app. Plays amazingly well and is a lot of fun if you enjoy the board game.
Nice game
Love this game
It's good enough that I want to manage a team over full season and possibly several. As it stands it's decent.
Works as advertised, found no bugs. Fun casual time waster game.
Fantastic game play! I hope you can add expansions and other base team options!

Update: Still a great game but the in-game layout is so clustered and ugly, but thankful the publishers logo is there so I know that uselss pile of information while making crucial in-game decisions. Fantastic game. I highly recommend it! Well worth it and a few expansions.

I bought the app to learn how the gameplay looks like before I decided to buy a tabletop version. And it wasn't a mistake. Tutorial clearly explains rules of the game, the app reflects a real version in detail and gives a lot of fun (and I’ve played only against AI). I can't wait to unbox and play my newly ordered Baseball Highlights: 2045 - Super Deluxe Edition :)

Excellent Deck Builder/ Deck Management game, even if you don't like baseball! Lot's of great strategic gameplay here. The starter decks add some asymmetrical aspects, so you'll need to pick a team and a style of play that'll get you the win. My wife and I are hooked, ***and we really appreciate that it doesn't have creepy anti Christian material like most other games do.***
Fun game. Accurate port of the boardgame
Great app.
Fantastic conversion of the board game. Really enjoying this! Are there any future plans to bring more expansions to the app?
Great game! Easy to learn and difficult to master. Been playing for a few months now.

This game is great its fun I like the cards but Is there a way to add extra voices to the game. Its needs more cheering maybe when they strike out maybe some clapping depending if you are playing at home. maybe different robot sounds for the new cards. And " lets go" for cards of high level naturals. Pitchers "here is the winde up and the pitch" People with glove -1 or -2 "Wow! What a play!" people with homeruns" Ok Here comes there heavy hitter" increase the season to 10 games to get more cards

I bought this app to play with my friends, as we love the board game version. However it appears that there is not an option for online play, even though there is a button for it. I also purchased the expansion pack #1 and it offered a hard difficulty A.I. at first and now I can't find that option. I would like to play the hard A.I. if you do not have an online version. Please assist. Edit - Also, I can't seem to get it to sync over to my tablet. I open the playstore and find the app but it wants me to buy it a 2nd time.
replyContent:
When playing against the AI, there are only 2 levels at the moment. 
For a more difficult challenge you can play the solo system from the boardgame and that will give you 5 skill levels to choose from. 
On-line play is definitely in there and is working. Get in touch with me at peterk@look.ca so we can take a look at your issue more closely.

content: Fun game. It plays just like the real game. It's a good way to play solo. No issues running on a Galaxy S7.
Love the game
Great game!
Great game, graphics/ui could be more polished but it is a small dev so understandable.
Anyone who likes deck builders should give it a chance even if the theme doesn't appeal. Runs great and is easy to play. Dev added some changes a while back makes the app perfect for me.
replyContent: Hi Drue. Even though you can't see your opponent's current card on your own screen, you can still see all of the important characteristics of that card in your mini-diamond (threatened hits, player type). You should be able to play through the games without ever needing to manually visit the opponent's board.

content: Great board game. Great app.
Awesome game! Plays just like the board game! Fantastic! God bless!
Love the game, but wish you could select which expansions you want to use to play online instead of all or nothing. I'm not a big fan of the error deck, but the first expansion pack is a must
One of my top three boardgames brought to the small screen with excellent AI and multiplayer. My only want would be to have more teams.
One of the best deck building games out there
No updates in a year. Difficulty is too easy. Would like to be able to play against the CPU with a random free agent deck.

I like the board game so I bought this version. It does a mostly good job recreating the board game. The interface is a little clunky/rough but it works ok so I'm satisfied. I also really like that you can play either the classic solo version or "evenly" against an AI. Haven't purchased any expansions yet.
Just like boardgame
very nice port of boardgame :)
Likely I'm missing cultural knowledge since the rules and feedback don't stick, making it difficult to want to play.
Fun fast game. Purchased upgrades on one device, but they did not appear on a second (same account). Had to uninstall and reinstall on the 2nd device for them to appear there.

Card game itself is great, but the game play is very limited. Just repeating a 7 game series over and over, seeing the same cards. Needs more cards, and a longer tournament of play where you face different teams. The draft system for replenishing your deck is also strange, when I tried to save my points to get the higher ranked cards  it didn't seem to work, but somehow my opponent kept getting them.
Very fun game. Wanted to use the app to make my decision on if I want to buy the board game, and I am going to be picking it up soon!
I need the physical game now
Plays like the board game. I want more commentary to set it apart.

Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact. Baseball highlights is a great card game , beautifully designed, whose digital version is competent and serviceable, but nothing more. The good AI and online functionality allows to warm up to the game and play with friends , great for trying out the game before a physical purchase. The lack of polish on the appearance, and the lack progression are what keep two stars away from this app. I recommend .
Fun game. Not so bad. BUT team cities limited to Boston, New York, and LA??? Can't stand looking at ANY of them (except for Mike Trout's Angels), so unfortunately, I'm uninstalling.
i taste like nachos
love the board game and this allows me to play on the go
Awesome app!

Very fun, and reasonable price for the expansions that add a few extra cards and abilities. It seems like the AI cheats sometimes as they always seem to have the perfect card come up at just the right time. More often than the odds say it should. Maybe I just need to get better at strategy, but it sure seems fishy.
replyContent: AI doesn't cheat. I promise.  :)

content: Fun game, good adaption of the board game with decent ai
A fun, challenging, and worthy adaptation of the physical board game! I play it every day on my commute home on the train.
very fun game and not hard to learn. I have played hundreds of games and it is my favorite mobile game. Kudos

Not bad, could use a bit of polising. The interface/sound/look all feel vacant, unsure if that is intentional. Played a handful of games and asked for a refund, just fell a bit short of my expectations coming from loving the table top original.
great fun
Awesome game and great app experience. Would be 5 starts if graphics were more hi res...

The graphics and interface are rough around the edges, but I just love this game too much to not recommend it. Gameplay it quick and makes for consistent interesting decisions with minimal drag from having to think about every little thing. It's a favorite when I've a bit of downtime.
just like the boardgame. love it!
Awesome simulation of the actual card game at a much lower price.
I love this game! it's a very fun experience, great adaptation of the boardgame!

Terrific representation of the physical board game (this app actually got me to buy said board game). It's such a good representation, I play it frequently to explore card combinations and free agent buying strategies to employ in the real game against friends. If you like a light 2 player game with decent strategic depth and terrific replayability, you can't go wrong here.

Great little deck building game that is easy to pick up and hard to put down.  I am looking forward to additional expansion packs and the additional starter teams and location.   Are more expansion packs coming?
replyContent: After I finish Football Highlights later this year, it's a definite possibility.

content: A little clunky and not every button does exactly what you might expect, but it works well once you figure out the quirks
It's fun. My only issue seems to be that the AI ALWAYS has the card it needs when performing a visitor save. And I'm not exaggerating.
replyContent: There's no AI cheating. It's pretty easy to put a versatile card in that slot. If you're the home team, you may want to consider playing your big hits before your last card to avoid the visitor save.

content: I've just been introduced the boardgame and was very pleased to discover the digital version. It is a great deck building game with lots of replay ability and strategy. The new easy to use online gameplay lets me play with old friends at the other end of the country. Great job!
Very fun. Easy to learn but difficult to master
Excellent implementation of the board game.
Lots of fun. Very good adaptation of physical board game
replyContent: Thank you! Glad you like it. Keep an eye out for the next patch, coming soon, which will be introducing on-line play with other players.

content: Gets pretty boring pretty quickly
Good adaptation of the boardgame. Could do with more challenging AI.
Great implementaion of the boardgame
Really fun baseball strategy

Tremendously fun baseball themed deck builder that suffers from a clunky, 
fairly ugly mobile UI. This is especially disappointing because the 
original game itself is so aesthetically pleasing. It's still fun, but the 
difficulty in selecting and cycling cards on a phone does keep the game 
from realizing its true potential.

Good game, but sometimes it just seems too coincidental that the game has 
the exact right card at the right moment to shut you down.

-1 star for the clunky interface. It's just not intuitive. That said, I 
love the game! Gameplay is fun and quick. There's a ton of replayability 
and value here. Recommended.
Close enough to the board game and a good digital port.
Great game, the details of the UI could be improved.

Really good implementation of a board game in app form. The AI is fun and 
challenging. Only downside is that the tutorial is a little dry and there 
aren't more options for teams or even modes of play. An option to keep 
track of stats across multiple plays or have an option to draft a team 
before starting a season would also have been fun.
Really very good
Good card gwmr, wish there was multiplayer
This game is already one of my favourite solo games.
Enjoy
Love the tactical challenge of when to play what cards, kind of like the tactics in real baseball!

I wish I could rate this game a five. It has a great theme, the strategy is deep, the AI is challenging, and it is just plain fun. The issue lies in how the app plays on the phone. This was clearly made for tablet and phones were an after thought. It is difficult to select and cycle through cards in your hand on your phone. Everything also looks extremely cramped. The tablet experience is much better. A fun game and the DLC is cheap and adds some interesting dimensions.
Great implementation! UI is a little weird to get used to with the stretched buttons and awkward card scrolling, but the overall app is solidly built.
Great game, Bad control, Ugly UI
Great implementation of the board game.
No refund button available literally a minute after purchase. What's the deal?
replyContent: You can't give an app a 1 star review because of an issue with the Google store which I have nothing to do with. Please, be reasonable! Contact me by email and send me your transaction number and I'll arrange your refund.

content: Love the game, would be 5 stars if it had online multiplayer. The only 2 player option is hots eat, which is nice, but I can't give a 5th star without online.
A good digital version of a hard-to-find card game
Cool game, but it desperately needs online play.

I bought this game as a test to see if I would want to buy the physical game.  It is a great implementation from what I can tell.  The controls work very well, for the most part, though I have had an issue switching between apps in the "buying" phase in the game.  I liked it so much, I bought all of the add-ons as well, and I think I will likely be buying the physical game in the future.  Easy to learn, but there is plenty of depth, especially with the expansions.

Game is good, though there are a few bugs. One in particular is that if a slow runner on 2nd and 3rd, and a a "clutch, single" is played, then they will both score. Note that the same behavior is experienced correctly with Average & Fast runners, but should only happen for them. Another bug is that Fast runners should always run +1 base, but don't seem to do so on inital hits, or on "clutch, single/double".   Game is still managable, but these bugs go against the rules, and can make things quite frustating. Also, the UI is definantly not the best looking one ever, but luckily the gameplay is solid.
Awesome concept
Great game. Fluid play. Add-ons are fun.
What an amazing game. Love this, always tense but rewarding.

So, this game took a lot of plays for me to like it. At first I thought it was clunky & I wasn't a fan. Some of the scrolling isn't smooth. However, the more I played the better I liked it. Now I can't stop. The game more than makes up for everything else. I can't always have the board game BH2045 with me, so this app rocks!
Controls, especially when playing on a phone, could be improved. Otherwise great
The actual card game is good and works in this app. Everything else from presentation to features feels extraordinarily lazy and uninspired.

It's "good".  It certainly follows the board game and is fun.  The actual board game has nice graphics and that's lost here a bit.  (I play on a tablet). When you click on the cards to view them they enlarge but are distorted a bit.  Not a deal breaker but....  it jumps pretty fast which is ok.  I do like it though it seems to need some slight tweaks in design.  It's probably  a $1 or $2 app. Having said that...I trust it will get better, it plays just fine, it will teach you strategy for the table top game.  I love to be able to play friends online, too.

With a bit more polish this could be a huge success, but as it stands feels a bit basic, the scrolling card animation and button aren't amazing and feel it's only catering for board gamers and perhaps only those who've played the real version.  Also feel they've missed a bit of a trick by not allowing further purchase of expansions and teams to mix things up, the bare bones is already there so this should be relatively simple to add, I do feel that the card pool for recruits seems smaller than the real game too but I have only played it twice so maybe unlucky.  Nueroshima Hex is an example of a game like this but transferred well to phone.
Fun game. Interface is a bit clunky

Needs to have your stats from your previous game plays. Add more expansions. Excellent game. I got it for Christmas and then bought the app. Needs to have your previous stats of all your wins and losses.
Awesome digital version of a great deck-building game. Can't wait for the developer's next game: Hostage Negotiator 😀.

Awesome game. Longer seasons? Career mode/campaign? More starting cities (Chicago)? Please? Upgrade definitions to add how checks are done(robot check for example)? Multiplayer seasons with drafts!!!!!! Please!!!
Fun implementation of the card game
Plays smoothly. No complaints!
Great game! Wish there was way too check cards already played though
best baseball board game ever made. well done.
Great take on a deck building Game!
Great app, sound is a little annoying.

Wish we could Save stats, and wish there were a few more choices for Play Modes.  But in general very well done.  Excellent implementation of an exciting and fun game.  Hope for more expansions (teams, etc).  Thanks!
Love it. Can't stop playing.

This game combines two of my favorite things:Baseball and Deck-building games. The idea is original and the game play is fun once you get the hang of it. The one problem is the limited scope. You are pretty much limited to choice of 4 cities and a maximum season of 7 games. More cities, more games and a greater variety of cards would make the game  better and increase replay value . But, as it stands, it is still a fun game and very entertaining.

The board game is a really fun game and this app can be a great way to feel out the mechanics so you can be even more ready for your next physical game. The app, however, needs a lot more polish to be a considered a good mobile game in its own right. The look of the app is very amateurish design-wise, especially with some of the buttons looking stretched out and downright ugly. I really like the game and its mechanics and I think a good app is a great way to expose people to it. Unfortunately, I think this app might turn a lot of people off.
Fantastic deckbuilder. The graphics could be better and so do the AI. I win every World series now that I'm experienced at the game. Still fun enough though!
Faithful to the board game, good tutorial. Will look forward to expansions. Needs more teams! Are they planned in a future expansion?
Very faithful to the original game. If you haven't played Baseball Highlights 2045, I highly recommend picking it up. It's very simple to learn and has tons of depth.
Faithful recreation of the card game

I own the physical version! I am thoroughly enjoying this Android version. Now please port this beauty over to Steam PC! Kudos to Mike Fitzgerald and all you wonderful developers involved with this OUTSTANDING game.
Yeah a good game. Bit pricey but far cheaper than phycial copy.
Excellent game.  I only wish the graphics were a little crisper.
Apart from stretched graphics on phone and unintuitive controls it's a good game. Any plans for online multiplayer (preferably asynchronous)?
Game is fun but the interface is awful. Browsing through your hand and through free agents is super clunky.
replyContent: Sorry you don't really like what I did. If possible, give it a shot on a tablet.

content: A fantastic implementation of one of the best two-player board games out there. A lot of subtle strategy and a lovely feeling of trying your best to let every player be heroic. This may surprise you with it's clever, innovative game design.

Fantastic game, really bad implementation. The controls are super clunky and the graphics are all stretched out. Icons are not very intuitive, only works in landscape mode. Honestly, it feels like a free app in terms of quality.
replyContent: Sorry you've had a bad experience. If you get a chance, try it out on a tablet - works much better. The phone implementation was the best I could manage at the time.

content: Love this game and the app makes it so much faster than the table top.

This is a great game. The app is done very well compared to the board game.  I have 2 minor complaints.  1st. The on-deck spot on the Board needs to be risen higher. It's sucks trying to remember your hitboxes and runners when it's time to use your pitch hitter because  we can't see them. 2nd. Can you add an undo or confirm  button in the draft market just in case we change our mind.  I highly recommend this game to any one. The one thing it's really missing is a online infrastructure to play against another human. The A.I is great but it's just more satisfying playing against a human.
replyContent: You can see your on deck player. Just hold your finger down on the card for a few seconds to zoom in on it.

content: Great implementation of the game. Only complaint is that I can't see the bottom of my on deck card. But very fun, and very well made app.
Needs network play.
I've never played the tabletop version but I love this game! Bought the expansions!
Dukes of Dice can't stop talking about this game, so I checked it out. Thinking of getting the physical version now.

I heard good things about the game and this app from BGG and grabbed it when it was on sale around Christmas. It may seem like it's a bit primitive but it's not... It's truly a good game. You may think it needs more animation, etc but it doesn't. It's a card game. Now if I could just win more consistently...
Fun game! Bought all the add ons. Definetly with it

This is a great game. Reminds me of Base Wars the Cyberball spin on baseball from Sega Genesis which I'm sure inspired this take on futuristic baseball. I'm not a big baseball fan but this game is a favorite  and is quite fun. I'll get the expansions too probably. I would like to see a Cyberball football type version of this if possible and consult me for ideas as I will get a portion of the sales for the idea lol. Cyberball was a futuristic football video game with robots and cyborgs playing football etc. Base Wars was a baseball version of Cyberball also made by Atari and was on Nintendo and Genesis. It had violent robots and cyborgs playing baseball. This game is a better version of Base Wars that's more accessible and plays well. I want more teams and more expansions. I also think an actual season play mode would be fun. Or online head to head against other players woild be fantastic
The game mechanics are amazing. Solid board game and will gladly pay for more expansions. The glaring shortcomings are the poorly thought out interface along with the uninspiring graphics.
I've been hearing lots of great things about Baseball Highlights 2045 now that I have it on my phone I'm completely addicted! I love this game!!!!
Lots of fun. Easy to learn.

Great game, the actual physical board game version is better if you play with another person. I know that this is accurate to the board game because I have both, but this is waaaaaay too hard!!! So far I've only been able to win a WS on Standard with very easy difficulty level. Versus AI I'm pretty sure is impossible to win against and any levels beyond very easy on Standard is next to impossible to win a World Series against as well. I don't need to win all of the time but losing every time isn't worth it either
replyContent: Hi Joshua. All skill levels are definitely winnable. Players are winning about 75% of the time versus the AI. Visit the forums at BGG for strategy tips or to get advice.

content: Chouette adaptation du jeu de société. Dommage que l'interface ne soit pas plus lêchée, surtout sur petits écrans.
Really enjoyed playing this on the go.  If you enjoy the board game then you will enjoy this game.

A very good adaptation of an excellent board game. Could really benefit from improved sound effects, though. A fun combination of robotic cybernetic stuff and realistic baseball ambience would be great.
I bought the board game then saw this. This app taught me how to play the game correctly.
Great game marred by a horrible UI.

Great implementation of an amazing game!  One suggestion:  since I have a big enough resolution on my phone I would prefer the tablet layout of the cards instead of flipping through them. (My device is a nexus 5x)
Great game, only downside is the GUI isn't great.

Love this one. Enjoying it so much that I bought all the expansion packs soon after purchasing the game itself and have been having a blast! I love that there are two different solo modes and play those exclusively. The game play is nice and quick but also in depth with detail and strategies. Most of all Baseball Highlights 2045 is pure FUN!! Recommended all the way!
Very nice port of a great game. My only suggestions would be an upgraded AI (maybe with 3-4 AI players) and improved sound/music.
Great game! Buy the actual cardgame!

Slow runners are scoring from second on singles all of a sudden as well as average runners scoring from first on doubles. I don't know how to direct message you or get a bug report but it is continuing to happen.
replyContent:
You can send a message to peterk @ look.ca. Or you can visit the BB Highlights 2045 page at Boardgame Geek to discuss with me and other users. I really need more info - which cards are being played, what the on-base situation is.

There are some card effects that can cause what you are seeing. Clutch is the obvious one. I doubt there is a bug.

content: Interesting solo game. Tutorial is really helpful :)
Great port of a great game. But at least one of the abilities doesn't work right. Runners advancing 2 on stolen base. Please fix to get to 5 stars.
replyContent: Send me a screenshot or a bug report having more details regarding the base stealing issue. I have not seen this or heard of it from other users.

content: It does what it needs to. Easily accesible and is quite fluid once you get passed the slight clunky interface.
Great heads-up tactical play regardless of the theme!
Really awesome port of the board game
Poor graphics

I played the game a while back and wasn't too impressed with the app.  The developer has made great improvements since then and the app is awesome.  The game itself is a lot of fun, and the app makes it really easy to follow what is going on.
Difficult to understand at first but with the effort
Great version of a wonderful game.

Great combo for card based game lovers and purist baseball fans. Really nice variety as no 2 games are identical. Just the right amount of challenge so it feels great when your strategy as team Manager pays off. One big problem though, I purchased all of the in-app expansions but had to uninstall the app and now I can't get them to load after I reinstall the app. Any way to load these expansions back onto my device? It just says I already purchased them but doesn't sync them to the app. Five stars if you can fix that. Thanks. UPDATE: The expansions suddenly started working after I changed the game mode to the 2 player Hot Seat. I'll take it. Thanks again for a great game that I can pass and play with friends on my tablet. This game is truly 5 stars!
replyContent: Hi Jason, not sure what happened there. If you uninstall and reinstall the game, and then visit the add-ons page, the expansions that were purchased should come back automatically. Glad you got it working!

content: This is my introduction to Baseball Highlights 2045, though I've been interested in as a board game for quite some time. It's fun and fast and the expansions are worth it in my opinion.   EDIT - I was misinformed about a perceived baserunning bug on clutch hits.
As fun as the original game

Really feels like a full baseball game in six cards. Too small though for my eyes.  Reply: I know about the holding finger to enlarge, however I find the response too slow.  However, I have kinda memorized the cards enough to know what they do without much problem. Thanks.
replyContent: Sorry you're having trouble with the text. I'm just double-checking that you know how to zoom in to magnify cards/stacks. Just hold your finger over any card or stack to magnify and see all of the cards much bigger.

content: This is a great implementation of the board game. The capture the feel and strategy of baseball
Great game! Easy to play!

An outstanding app implementation of a great boardgame.  This was already a brilliant game when it only allowed playing the boardgame's solitaire mode but the recent addition of AI players has taken it to a new level. One of the best games on the Play Store without a doubt.
Pretty fun game.
Some occasional bugs, but the game is very fun
Good implementation of a good board game.  Could do with further development to either remove some of the screens that roll back and forth between teams.  And the stats aren't built up.

I'd always been curious about the physical version of this game, but I wanted to try it before I bought it.  Lo and behold, there's an app for that!  The game is a whole lot of fun, and it's just the right amount of challenging.  And yes, it definitely convinced me to buy the physical version.  Can't wait.  I hope more add-ons are planned.  I could see myself playing this for a long time.
Amazing board game, and this app is an excellent way to play it. Could be prettier, but it's very functional.
Love the boxed version and this is just as good! The expansion adds a lot of content and the new AI plays really well!

Good baseball strategy, a little deck building, and incredibly quick play sessions. The presentation is functional, but very easy to use and stable. Would happily throw a few more bucks the dev's way with some expansion packs.
My only complaint is I wish it kept running stats, like wins and losses or runs per game overall.
Good game, plays well. Wish multi player was available instead of hot seat. Bring on the expansions.
Enjoyed the deck building and the game play.

Fantastic game some graphics are stretched or very low resolution, and there are a few UI improvements that would make the game better. Could be a 5 star with updates and expansions, but currently a 3/5.
My favorite board game in an app!
Awesome. Slightly crude, but awesome.
Just missing that cardboard smell.
Will be getting the board (card?) game!
Love the board game, and love the app. I too hope to be able to purchase the expansions here, especially the coaches expansion.
Very cool game.
Love the post steam punk artwork!
Really grabs the feel of a baseball series. Enjoying it immensely.

I ordered the analogue cardboard version of this game to add to my large but mostly baseball absent collection. I didn't know the digital version existed, but saw a post on bgg about it for iOS.  I looked it up, and low and behold, tablet Android ftw!  I ordered it immediately and have been very happy with the way it plays.  It's not the most polished app you're going to find, but it is an accurate emulation of the board game, and it is a load of fun in the world of baseball simulations, which journeys can often be arduous and long winded.  There is a lot of strategy in making a team successful, and faithfully highlights manages to encapsulate this in just six rounds of play.
replyContent: Glad you're enjoying the game Donovan. Thanks for the kind words. Keep an eye out for a fairly major update in the next week or two which should bump up the fun level a little.

content: Love the game, but here lately every time I try to open the app nothing happens. It will not open to play no matter what. I would like this fixed seeing I paid $6.99
replyContent: Hi Tyler, Just saw this now. Sorry for the difficulties you're having but I haven't changed anything on my end that could cause this. Other users on the same version of Android as you seem to be doing OK. I would try an uninstall and a fresh install and after that you can send me a support email and we can try to get to the bottom of it.

content: Other than the non interactive tutorial this is a fantastic game!
The board game is better but this is an awesome substitute. A+
Love the board game, love the app. Does a great job of recreating the most innovative sports board game. Everyone should get this app.
Fun, but some of the features of the board game are not included, like the 3 game pre series series and the human player is always the visitor. Hopefully the board game  expansions will be available.
replyContent: Play versus an AI (as an alternative to the solo game from the boardgame) is coming later this year. Thanks for your support!

content: I've always wanted to try the actual card game but have never had a chance.  After playing this I am definitely going to be picking up the card game up.  Lot's of fun!
Great game. I hope we will see more coming our way
A fun game and not too buggy.
I love the board game. The app is outstanding. The layout and game play is very well done. I can't wait for the expansion sets to be released. Thanks.
Awesome! My favorite game now on an app! Please add the expansion sets. I will gladly pay for them. I want Pete Biggio!

How in the world do you get it to alternate between home and away in solo mode?? Having to go first each time is a real downer!  In light of Peter's explanation, I bumped up my star rating.  It makes sense, and I do take advantage of that card on deck.  It's still a very good app.
replyContent: Hi Paul, that's the way the solo game from the boardgame works. You actually get to set-up for something called a Visitor Save when you're on the road so it's not really a disadvantage going last if you have a good card waiting in your On Deck slot. When I add true versus AI play later in the year, home and vistor will alternate.

content: Good app version of the game but the AI is ridiculous. Never behind in score and always has the perfect card in reserve.  It's almost laughable. The rare moment you think you might actually win is when the AI pulls the perfect card out of nowhere. ..every frickin time!
replyContent: Hi R. I know that you're not going to believe me, but the current solitaire play (taken from the boardgame) has no real AI at all. The opponent cards are played in the order they were drawn with no decision making involved at all!  The AI deck will not change throughtout the world seriesm, while your team starts weak and gets stronger.

content: Extremely sluggish on my Nexus 10 (odd since I can play fully 3D games on this tablet). Doesn't hide Android nav panel, which hides critical buttons in the game (i.e. buttons at bottom in rules UI) Will update review when tech issues fixed.  UPDATE 1/25/16 The UI issue went away after a restart. Was probably a fluke. Performance is still horrendous, to the point of unplayable.
replyContent:
Hi Matthew. Would you be able to send me a screenshot of what it looks like on your device? Surprised that it's off because my main test device is the same aspect ratio.
================
Send me an email please or provide a way for me to contact you. You are the only customer complaining about performance issues and I'm a little bewildered by it.

content: I like the idea of the game and everything works, but even on very easy the game is very frustrating as a new player because the AI has a much better deck than I do.
replyContent: Thank you for the review. With a bit of practice you should be able to win on the Normal difficulty about 95% of the time. Use pinch hitters and your visitor save ability wisely. Try to cancel out the opponents most powerful cards. Don't always buy the highest priced free agents if they don't fit your strategy.

content: Had trouble installing (error -18 just had to remove SD card to install) Dev  email me right away and helped resolve the  issue .   Great game great Dev  team!
replyContent: Hi Jim, Drop me an email let me know what's happening.

content: Could use some more graphic design polish and music. Great implementation of the board game though. Here's hoping for the expansions.
replyContent: Hi Caleb. Thanks for the review. Did the frequent crashing you had earlier sort itself out?

content: Great implementation of a fun and challenging game.
First of all, this is my all time favorite tabletop game hands down and this is a perfect implementation of that game. What else needs to be said? Download this game!
More excellent themed deckbuilders? Sign me up!
A flawless implementation of what has become my favorite card game. I cannot recommend this highly enough.
Great game and really well done implementation for the fans and everyone that likes a good game.
